name: CEH v9
subtitle: Certified Ethical Hacker
description: EC-Council's Ethical Hacking and Countermeasures (CEH) covers concepts and tools related to exploiting systems, networks, devices and operating platforms. This includes hacking concepts such as vulnerability assessment, network intrusion, reverse engineering, defacing websites, damaging network appliances, launching distributed denial-of-service attacks, massive worm propagation, breaking passwords, brute-forcing authentication systems, cracking encryption, exploiting systems, advance viruses, Trojans, and other malware. This certificate is targeted at site administrators, security professionals, auditors and anyone who is concerned about the integrity of the network infrastructure.

episodes.title: Overview
episodes.description: EC-Council's Ethical Hacking and Countermeasures (CEH) covers concepts and tools related to exploiting systems, networks, devices and operating platforms. This includes hacking concepts such as vulnerability assessment, network intrusion, reverse engineering, defacing websites, damaging network appliances, launching distributed denial-of-service attacks, massive worm propagation, breaking passwords, brute-forcing authentication systems, cracking encryption, exploiting systems, advance viruses, Trojans, and other malware. This certificate is targeted at site administrators, security professionals, auditors and anyone who is concerned about the integrity of the network infrastructure.

episodes.title: Introduction to Ethical Hacking
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike talk about what to expect from the CEHv9 series. They cover some vocabulary to begin laying a foundation of knowledge for the rest of the series. They also discuss some real world examples of attacks.

episodes.title: Introduction to Ethical Hacking Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike continue to introduce CEHv9. They talk about what it means to be a Certified Ethical Hacker.

episodes.title: Introduction to Ethical Hacking Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike their introduction to CEHv9. They differentiate between a hacker and a Certified Ethical Hacker. They look at the phases of the hacking lifecycle and the different classifications of hackers.In this episode, Adam and Mike look at information security controls as well as some security laws and standards that a CEH needs to be familiar with. They also look at some resources available to the Certified Ethical Hacker.

episodes.title: Introduction to Ethical Hacking Part 4
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike look at information security controls as well as some security laws and standards that a CEH needs to be familiar with. They also look at some resources available to the Certified Ethical Hacker.

episodes.title: Footprinting and Reconnaissance
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike take a first look at footprinting and reconnaissance. They talk about where to look to gather information, and what types of information that can be discovered.

episodes.title: Footprinting and Reconnaissance Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike continue their discussion on footprinting and reconnaissance. They look at different tools that can be used to begin the footprinting process.

episodes.title: Footprinting and Reconnaissance Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike talk about the importance of having a footprinting methodology. They look at using search engines and other tools to begin painting a picture of the attack target, like the Google Hacking Database and the Shodan browser.

episodes.title: Footprinting and Reconnaissance Part 4
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike finish their discussion on footprinting. They look at the information that can be gathered from an email. They also look at Google alerts, and how they can be used to our advantage.

episodes.title: Scanning Networks
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike begin their discussion on the next phase in the hacking lifecycle, scanning. They talk about the process of scanning a network, looking for live hosts. They also discuss other types of scans, how they can be used, and what information can be gathered.

episodes.title: Scanning Networks Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike demonstrate performing different scans. They use tools like hping3, Nmap, Zenmap, and Wireshark to perform scans. They also look at proxies and anonymizers.

episodes.title: Scanning Networks Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike complete their look at scanning. They talk about countermeasures that can be used to protect against scans. They look at firewalls, proxies, and VPNs.

episodes.title: Enumeration
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike begin phase three of the attack lifecycle, enumeration. They look at using tools like NBTStat and Netstat to enumerate open ports and established connections. They also look at tools like Task Manager, and the PS suite, to list running processes.

episodes.title: Enumeration Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike continue their conversation on enumeration. They demonstrate using tools like CurrPorts and HiJackThis to enumerate systems. They also look at SuperScan, MegaPing, Nmap, and Hyena.

episodes.title: Enumeration Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike go deeper into their discussion on enumeration. They look at different techniques that can be used for enumeration, as well as some enumeration countermeasures.

episodes.title: System Hacking
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike start the fourth phase of the attack lifecycle, system hacking, or gaining access. They discuss the process of taking information gathered in the reconnaissance, scanning and enumeration phases, and using it to gain access to the target system. They also talk about the concepts behind password cracking.

episodes.title: System Hacking Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike talk about ways to obtain passwords. They discuss spyware and keystroke loggers. They also talk about the importance of educating end users and different ways to accomplish this.

episodes.title: System Hacking Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike continue their discussion on system hacking. They demonstrate alternate data streams and how they can be used to hide information and malware. They also talk about tools used to modify log files.

episodes.title: System Hacking Part 4
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike demonstrate using Metasploit to hack a Windows 7 system. They also demonstrate using steganography to hide data, and using keystroke loggers to capture data.

episodes.title: Malware Threats
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike begin their discussion on malware. They define some basic terminology pertaining to malware. They also discuss common ways that malware is able to infect a system.

episodes.title: Malware Threats Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike continue their discussion on malware threats. They show some examples of some simple virus code. Then they use IDA to reverse engineer a sample virus. They also talk about the various trojans that are used to hijack a machine.

episodes.title: Malware Threats Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike continue their discussion on malware threats, focusing on viruses. They discuss the different types of viruses and the symptoms of an infection. They also talk about methods to determine if a system is infected, like scanning for listening ports.

episodes.title: Sniffing
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike look at the concept of sniffing network traffic. They talk about the OSI model and break down the data packet. They also look at ways to sniff traffic in switched ethernet environments, like spanned ports on a switch.

episodes.title: Sniffing Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike continue their discussion on sniffing network traffic. They demonstrate how to spoof a mac address on a node using tools like SMAC different tools. They also look at ways to detect ARP attacks, with tools like XArp to detect arp attacks. Then they demonstrate an ARP poisoning attack using Cain and Abel.

episodes.title: Sniffing Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike discuss the mechanics behind sniffing. They explain how a CAM table in a switch works. Then they discuss the concept of mac flooding, and how it can be used to attack a switch to facilitate sniffing network traffic.

episodes.title: Social Engineering
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike discuss the concept of social engineering. They demonstrate using the SET, the Social Engineering Toolkit to perform a social engineering attack.

episodes.title: Denial of Service
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike discuss the concept of denial of service and distributed denial of service attacks. They talk about different methods that can be used to monitor for and protect against these types of attacks.

episodes.title: Denial of Service Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike demonstrate how to execute a denial of service attack. They use hping3 to launch a syn flood attack and a icmp flood attack. They use Wireshark to show the attack process.

episodes.title: Session Hijacking
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike begin their discussion on session hijacking. They start by looking at how session hijacking works. They also talk about the difference between spoofing and hijacking. Then they break down the steps of a Man in the Browser attack.

episodes.title: Session Hijacking Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike discuss cross site scripting (XSS) and cross site request forgery (CSRF). They also talk about the steps involved in a TCP hijack attack. Then they demonstrate how to use ZED Attack Proxy to perform a MitM attack.

episodes.title: Session Hijacking Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike start by going over the steps to do IP spoofing using source routed packets. Then they talk about IPSec, defining the various components of IPSec, and diagraming the security association process. They also describe the two IPSec modes, Authentication Header and Encapsulated Security Payload.

episodes.title: Web Servers
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike look at hacking web servers. They discuss the methodologies used to attack web servers. They look at some tools used to attack web servers. They also discuss mitigation techniques to protect web servers.

episodes.title: Web Applications
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike start by differentiating between web server and web application attacks. They look at the OWASP Top Ten list and describe several different types of attacks. They cover the web application attack methodology and look at countermeasures to defend against web application attacks

episodes.title: Web Applications Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike demonstrate some different web application attack tools. They perform a directory traversal attack, some banner grabbing, and footprint a web server. They also demonstrate using a web application firewall detection tool.

episodes.title: SQL Injection
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike discuss SQL injection attacks. They define the different types of SQL injection attacks and look at the commands that make up an attack. Then they demonstrate performing a SQL injection attack using sqlmap.

episodes.title: Wireless Networks
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike discuss the basics of wireless networks. They define terminology specific to wireless networks, and take a look at the wireless standards of the different IEEE standards. They also look at the available authentication methods and different types of wireless antennas.

episodes.title: Wireless Networks Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike continue their discussion on wireless networks. They talk about the different encryption methods available to secure wireless networks. They also explain TKIP and temporal keys.

episodes.title: Wireless Networks Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike shift their focus to wireless attacks. They talk about the steps involved in a wireless MitM attack. They also look at Bluetooth, defines various Bluetooth attacks and modes.

episodes.title: Mobile Platforms
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike discuss hacking mobile platforms. They start by looking at the OWASP Mobile Top Ten vulnerability list. Then they demonstrate using Kali Linux and Metasploit to create a reverse TCP application package.

episodes.title: IDS, Firewalls and Honeypots
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike talk about intrusion detection and intrusion prevention systems, how they work and where they are placed in our network. They look at the methods these systems use to detect attacks. Then they discuss firewalls, comparing stateful and stateless firewalls.

episodes.title: IDS, Firewalls and Honeypots Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike demonstrate how to configure Snort, a free and open source network intrusion prevention system. They edit the configuration file for Snort, and add websites to a black list. They also look at several free proxy sites.

episodes.title: IDS, Firewalls and Honeypots Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike finish their conversation on IDSs, firewalls, and honeypots. They describe different types of attacks that can be used to hide an attack and evade IDS systems. They also talk about honeypots and how they are used.

episodes.title: Cloud Computing
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike begin their discussion on cloud computing. They talk about the defining characteristics of cloud computing and define several key terms. They also go over the different cloud models.

episodes.title: Cloud Computing Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike continue their discussion on cloud computing. They look at the different roles found in the cloud computing business model. They look at potential vulnerabilities associated with cloud computing, and how the threats to our data change as we migrate to the cloud.

episodes.title: Cloud Computing Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike continue to look at the treats and vulnerabilities associated with cloud computing. They also look at OWASP's Top Ten list of vulnerabilities.

episodes.title: Cloud Computing Part 4
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike finish their discussion on cloud computing. They continue to look at various threats associated with cloud computing. They also look at how cloud computing changes incident response procedures. Then they examine countermeasures that can be used to protect our cloud-based resources.

episodes.title: Cryptography
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike talk about cryptography. They define a list of terms that will prove important for the rest of their discussion on cryptography, as well as the exam.

episodes.title: Cryptography Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike continue their discussion on cryptography. They focus on the concepts of symmetric and asymmetric encryption, and non-repudiation.

episodes.title: Cryptography Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike look at the different encryption algorithms and talk about the strengths and weaknesses of them. They also compare stream and block ciphers, as well as hashing algorithms.

episodes.title: Cryptography Part 4
episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Mike demonstrate various cryptographic techniques. They use the Advanced Encryption Package to encrypt a package. They also demonstrate using VeraCrypt, and create a self-signed certificate on a MacBook.
